Our Exterior Furniture

Two excellent wood choices: Black Locust & Eastern Red Cedar.

Black Locust, a native hardwood of the Southern Appalachian Mountains, is known to last well over 50 years in direct contact with the ground.

The uniquely-colored Eastern Red Cedar flourishes in the Appalachian Mountains and naturally resists decay, making it excellent for outdoor use.

Quality, comfort, and style, seamlessly integrated.

We round all edges and sand all surfaces to provide improved appearance and comfort. Premium exterior glue firmly secures all joints, and rust-proof stainless steel screws are used for longevity and durability. Mortise and tenon joinery reduces visibility of fasteners for a refined appearance.

Intrinsic beauty that remains beautiful.

Unpainted furniture is finished with a PPG architectural sealant to prolong its natural beauty against the elements. Painted furniture is given four coats of paint: two coats of oil- based primer and two coats of Sherwin Williams 25-year Super Paint.

Locally made. Environmentally friendly.

Right Angle Woodworks is based right here in Western North Carolina. We craft our furniture from non-endangered woods where natural reforestation outpaces harvesting.

Contact us for a free quote.
